conclusion: Identify the relationship between pressure and temperature from the p-T graph.
The p-T graph shows a linear relationship between pressure (p) and temperature (T). The graph starts at 0.5 x 10^6 Pa at 200 K and increases to 1.5 x 10^6 Pa at 600 K.
Calculate the slope of the p-T graph using the formula m = (change in p) / (change in T).
The change in p is 1.5 x 10^6 Pa - 0.5 x 10^6 Pa = 1.0 x 10^6 Pa, and the change in T is 600 K - 200 K = 400 K.
The slope m = 1.0 x 10^6 Pa / 400 K = 2.5 x 10^3 Pa/K.
Use the slope to find the pressure at 600 K using the equation p = mT + b.
From the graph, the y-intercept is 0.5 x 10^6 Pa.
The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is 1.5 x 10^6 Pa.
